I20041216-2000

This test failure occurrs often in builds, but not locally:

Watch expression did not change 

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Watch expression did not change
at 
org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.core.WatchExpressionTests.testNonDeferredExpression
(WatchExpressionTests.java:89)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.DebugSuite$1.run(DebugSuite.java:53)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

Looking more closely at this test, it is flawed. The test is verifying that a 
watch expression added after a thread suspends will update. However, it is the 
WatchExpressionAction that ensures an expression updates when it is added, not 
the expression view. The test passes only when timing permits - i.e. the 
expression gets added to the expression view before it receives an selection 
change event from the debug view.

The test should be removed, or the expression view event handler should be 
changed to update expressions as they are added.

Fixed. For now, I have removed the test from future builds. Changes in 
WatchExpressionTests. Not sure we need/want to change the udpate behavior of 
the view/event handler.
